headline.main: Dr. Richard Daines, Former Health Commissioner, Dies at 60

docs.abstract: Dr. Daines, who presided over hospital downsizing, the fight against swine flu and an attempt to enact a soda tax, died at his family farm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Richard F. Daines, the former state health commissioner who presided over hospital downsizing, the fight against swine flu and an unsuccessful attempt to enact a soda tax, died Saturday at his family farm in Dutchess County.
docs.snippet: Dr. Daines, who presided over hospital downsizing, the fight against swine flu and an attempt to enact a soda tax, died at his family farm.
